translations: <非正式>鬼，幽灵；<美，非正式>密探，间谍；<美，旧>黑鬼；（尤指无端）让人恐惧的东西
使惊慌，惊吓；<非正式>（尤指动物）突然受惊

sentences.sentence: That might spook the buyers of bonds that finance all those deficits.
sentences.translation: 那可能会让所有这些赤字融资债券的买家感到恐慌。

sentences.sentence: Televiewers, sick of hoary Hoot Gibson oaters and antique spook comedies, wonder when, if ever, they will see fresh, first-class Hollywood films.
sentences.translation: 电视观众早已厌倦了过时的胡特·吉布森西部片和落伍的惊悚喜剧，他们不知道什么时候才能看到新鲜的、一流的好莱坞电影。

sentences.sentence: As for what to do with a haunted house, the methods vary; running out the front door screaming is one option, but you can also get to know the spook.
sentences.translation: 至于如何应付鬼魂屋，方法各异；一个选择是尖叫着跑出前门，但你也可以了解这个幽灵。
